snippet: Brett H. McGurk, who served under President Bush and is now a special envoy for President Obama, worked tirelessly for 14 months to negotiate the exchange of prisoners with Iran.
abstract: Profile of Brett H McGurk, Pres Obama’s special envoy to global coalition fighting Islamic State; McGurk has played central role in three of administration’s most sensitive diplomatic efforts in Middle East--helping to broker transition to new Iraqi government in 2014, holding together 65-country alliance to combat Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and leading secret talks to free Americans held in Iran.
lead_paragraph: Brett H. McGurk, who served under President Bush and is now a special envoy for President Obama, worked tirelessly for 14 months to negotiate the exchange of prisoners with Iran.

headline.main: Iran Negotiations Add to Special Envoy’s Reputation as ‘a Doer’
headline.print_headline: Iran Negotiations Add to Special Envoy’s Reputation as ‘a Doer’

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
